column4: I have an s-video output on my desktop pc, but how can I switch the outputs so that it goes to the extra video device? (No fn keys)
what is the model of your video card for starters?
it's an ATI All-In-Wonder 9000
look up ATI's xorg.conf optsions.
http://www.google.com/search?q=ati+ubuntu+S-Video+out
check that link out.
okay, thank you. I was under the impression that I had all necessary drivers, since compiz-fusion works flawlessly
you do have all the drivers, its just an option in the xorg.conf configuration file.
for the s-video out, do you know what I might be looking for in my xorg.conf file?
you're going to have to learn to use the forum & google. I'll TELL you the answer this time.
give me  second.
I can narrow it down to either "monitor" or "screen", but since things can get really screwed up when you mess with xorg.conf...
do a "cp -arfvp /etc /etc.bak
alright, thank you very much
http://gentoo-wiki.com/HOWTO_TV-Out#X_configuration
yep; so they want me to install a different driver now for ati?
no...
I tried editing my xorg.conf to match the wiki, but I still only get video output when the xserver isn't running; as soon as it starts up, my tv goes blank
let me get my fstab line for you.
/etc/fstab is here http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/3173/
fstab for video outputs?
I thought so... but you told me to check out your fstab at pastebin
it seemed like you got me confused with someone else
